arm_group.description: the patients  who have no intervention with calcium ionophore during ICSI cycle
the patients whose oocytes are incubated with calcium ionophore solution during ICSI cycle

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate calcium ionophore solution on fertilization rate of
      patients during intracytoplasmic sperm injection who have poor ovarian reserve

clinical_study.brief_title: Calcium Ionophore Solution Can Increase Fertilization Rate in Patients During Intracytoplasmic Sperm Injection(ICSI) Who Have Poor Ovarian Reserve?

detailed_description.textblock:
During ICSI cycle , female  patients who have poor ovarian reserve have low oocyte numbers.
      So by  calcium ionophore solution which we know that it can increase fertilization rate in
      males who have azospermia or globozoospermia. we planned to check if this solution can
      increase fertilization rate also in poor ovarian reserve patients?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  infertile couples who have no male factor infertility

          -  infertile females who are poor ovarian reserve

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  infertile couples who have male factor infertility

          -  infertile female who have endometriosis

intervention.description: After microinjection of sperm into the oocyte, oocytes are incubated for 15 minutes in a 30 microlitre droplet of  calcium ionomycin solution

facility.name: baskent university obstetric and gynecology, reproductive endocrinology and IVF unit

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Calcium Ionophore Solution on Fertilization Rate During ICSI Cycles of Poor Ovarian Reserve Patients

other_outcome.description: To detect if calcium ionophore can affect fertilization rate in a reverse manner than expected
other_outcome.measure: calcium ionophore can decrease fertilization rate

primary_outcome.description: Before Intracytoplasmic sperm injection adding calcium ionophore solution to the medium can increase fertilization rate of oocytes or not?
primary_outcome.measure: calcium ionophore solution effect on fertilization rate

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Effect  of calcium ionophore solution on fertilization rate  during  ICSI cycles of poor ovarian reserve patients

secondary_outcome.description: İf the calcium ionophore can increase fertilization rate ,  pregnancy rate up to 20 weeks, can increase or not?
secondary_outcome.measure: Calcium ionophore solution increase on going pregnancy rate

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
